problem.markdown:
>>1) How old is ceramics history in old and new world respectively?<< (x) 12,000 years ago in the Old World and about 5,000 years ago in the New World ( ) 10,000 years ago in the Old World and about 7,000 years ago in the New World ( ) 8,000 years ago in the Old World and about 5,000 years ago in the New World ( ) 11,000 years ago in the Old World and about 4,000 years ago in the New World
>>2) Can we examine the question of social inequality by analyzing pottery ?<< (x) Yes ( ) No
>>3) What is Estimated Vessel Equivalents ?<< ( ) number of pieces identified as the same ( ) total weight of pieces identified as the same (x) measuring the percentage of surviving pot rim from individual vessels ( ) the broken sherds
>>4) What is sherd count?<< (x) recording the number of pieces identified as the same ( ) recording the total weight of pieces ( ) recording the total weight of pieces identified as the same ( ) measuring the percentage of surviving pot rim
>>5) Why do we compare prehistoric ceramics with regional ceramic sequences?<< ( ) for metric attributes (x) to place the assemblage into chronological and cultural context ( ) identification of vessel form, function, and design ( ) identification of manufacturing techniques
>>6) The analysis of__________ ceramics allows archaeologists to construct cultural sequences.<< (x) prehistoric ceremics ( ) proto historic ceremics ( ) early history ( ) historical period
>>7) What is main reason to Collect and Study pottery?<< ( ) it was easily broken, does not ( ) decay ( ) could not be recycled ( ) often the most abundant type of artifact (x) all of them
>>8) What do you understand by experimental studies?<< ( ) studies consist of controlled experiments used in manufacturing processes by refitting (x) studies consist of controlled experiments used to replicate prehistoric ceramic manufacturing processes ( ) studies consist of uncontrolled experiments used to replicate posthistoric ceramic manufacturing processes ( ) both a and b
>>9) What make ceramic assemblage one of the most resources from archaeological site<< ( ) The combination of abundance ( ) Near indestructibility and almost unique plasticity ( ) it was not easily broken, does decay (x) a and b
>>10) A fabric series provides examples of pots made in different places<< (x) True ( ) False
problem.p: 1) How old is ceramics history in old and new world respectively?

choicegroup.label: 1) How old is ceramics history in old and new world respectively?
choicegroup.choice: 12,000 years ago in the Old World and about 5,000 years ago in the New World
10,000 years ago in the Old World and about 7,000 years ago in the New World
8,000 years ago in the Old World and about 5,000 years ago in the New World
11,000 years ago in the Old World and about 4,000 years ago in the New World

problem.p: 2) Can we examine the question of social inequality by analyzing pottery ?

choicegroup.label: 2) Can we examine the question of social inequality by analyzing pottery ?
choicegroup.choice: Yes
No

choicegroup.label: 3) What is Estimated Vessel Equivalents ?
choicegroup.choice: number of pieces identified as the same
total weight of pieces identified as the same
measuring the percentage of surviving pot rim from individual vessels
the broken sherds

choicegroup.label: 4) What is sherd count?
choicegroup.choice: recording the number of pieces identified as the same
recording the total weight of pieces
recording the total weight of pieces identified as the same
measuring the percentage of surviving pot rim

problem.p: 5) Why do we compare prehistoric ceramics with regional ceramic sequences?

choicegroup.label: 5) Why do we compare prehistoric ceramics with regional ceramic sequences?
choicegroup.choice: for metric attributes
to place the assemblage into chronological and cultural context
identification of vessel form, function, and design
identification of manufacturing techniques

problem.p: 6) The analysis of__________ ceramics allows archaeologists to construct cultural sequences.

choicegroup.label: 6) The analysis of__________ ceramics allows archaeologists to construct cultural sequences.
choicegroup.choice: prehistoric ceremics
proto historic ceremics
early history
historical period

problem.p: 7) What is main reason to Collect and Study pottery?

choicegroup.label: 7) What is main reason to Collect and Study pottery?
choicegroup.choice: it was easily broken, does not
decay
could not be recycled
often the most abundant type of artifact
all of them

problem.p: 8) What do you understand by experimental studies?

choicegroup.label: 8) What do you understand by experimental studies?
choicegroup.choice: studies consist of controlled experiments used in manufacturing processes by refitting
studies consist of controlled experiments used to replicate prehistoric ceramic manufacturing processes
studies consist of uncontrolled experiments used to replicate posthistoric ceramic manufacturing processes
both a and b

problem.p: 9) What make ceramic assemblage one of the most resources from archaeological site

choicegroup.label: 9) What make ceramic assemblage one of the most resources from archaeological site
choicegroup.choice: The combination of abundance
Near indestructibility and almost unique plasticity
it was not easily broken, does decay
a and b

problem.p: 10) A fabric series provides examples of pots made in different places

choicegroup.label: 10) A fabric series provides examples of pots made in different places
choicegroup.choice: True
False
